scopecontent.p: This volume appears to be the journal of a blacksmith who worked in the central Pennsylvania area during the second quarter of the 19th century. Entries that imply the blacksmith trade include "1 ax drest," "1 shovel mendet," "steelt shou," and "1 hoe sharpt." It also appears that this artisan bartered for his services, accepting as payment bushels of wheat and other similar commodities. The location for many of the entries dated 1838 and 1839 is Boalsburg (Centre County, Pa.), while the location for later entries, 1840-41, is Gaysport (Blaire County, Pa.) A furnace began operating in Gaysport in 1836 which might explain this artisan's apparent relocation. Several years after this blacksmith relocated, a foundry began operating in Gaysport as well in 1846.
